meanings.definition: To release from restraint or confinement.
meanings.sent1: She was loosing the dog from its leash.
meanings.sent2: The magician was loosing the ropes that bound him.
meanings.sent3: The key to loosing the treasure chest was hidden under the rock.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, he was loosing the arrow from his bow.
meanings.sent5: The hero was loosing the prisoners from their chains, setting them free.

meanings.sent1: He was loosing his grip on the rope.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was loosing the belt to make it more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: Loosing the knot in the shoelaces made it easier to run.
meanings.sent4: The warm weather was loosing the knots in the tangled necklace.
meanings.sent5: She was loosing the tension in the rubber band, making it easier to stretch.

meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, the team was loosing the game.
meanings.sent2: She was loosing her lead as the race went on.
meanings.sent3: The detective was loosing the battle against the clever criminal.
meanings.sent4: The candidate was loosing support as the election approached.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was loosing the race against time to find the hidden treasure.
